summary: This document is a correspondence from Janet E. Young, a Vice President at JPMorgan, to Rich Kahn and Darren Indyke regarding a data tape containing names and entities affiliated with Jeffrey Epstein. The letter reassures that there is no evidence of inappropriate use of the data and outlines the Chase Identity Protection services available to individuals listed on the tape.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is mentioned as a key individual associated with various entities listed on the data tape.

persons.name: Richard Karin
persons.context: Richard Karin is addressed in the correspondence as a Chief Investment Officer at JPMorgan.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Darren Indyke is mentioned as an associate of Richard Karin and is included in the correspondence regarding the data tape.

persons.name: Janet E. Young
persons.context: Janet E. Young is the author of the correspondence, providing information about the data tape and Chase Identity Protection.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell is mentioned as one of the entities associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is listed as an entity associated with Jeffrey Epstein.
Janet E. Young is a Vice President at JPMorgan, addressing Richard Karin in her correspondence.
Janet E. Young communicates with Darren Indyke regarding the data tape, indicating a professional relationship.

locations: 301 East 661 Street, Suite 10 B, New York, NY 10065
keyFacts: The document discusses a data tape from 2006 containing names and entities affiliated with Jeffrey Epstein.
No evidence has been found that the data on the tape has been used inappropriately.
Chase Identity Protection services are offered to individuals listed on the data tape, including credit monitoring and identity theft assistance.
The letter emphasizes that special hardware and software are required to access the data on the tape.
